content.question: Evidence in the excerpt best corroborates which of the following?

choices.label: Southern politicians would not abandon slavery, and they believed Lincoln was a threat to that system.
Sectional divisions were not as deep as many thought, and there was agreement about gradual abolition.
Political leadership in previous administrations had successfully limited sectional conflict.
Lincoln viewed foreign influences as serious threats to the stability of the United States.

content.answer: Southern politicians would not abandon slavery, and they believed Lincoln was a threat to that system.
